methods.description: Returns the weekly gasoline report. This resource pulls back the report with ProductLine = "US Weekly Gasoline Demand Report". Keep in mind that you must be subscribed to the gasoline weekly report to be able to receive data back from this resource.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to restrict the number of records returned if needed to be less than max.

methods.description: Returns a distinct list of all reports are available and that one is subscribed to.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to restrict the number of records returned if needed to be less than max.

methods.description: Returns all Spending Pulse reports (with the exception of the gasoline weekly report, which has its own resource), that one is subscribed to.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to restrict the number of records returned if needed to be less than max.

parameters.name: productLine
parameters.description: Product Line.  Either ?US Executive Report? or ?Weekly Sales?

parameters.name: publicationCoveragePeriod
parameters.description: Publication Coverage Period indicates what period is to be covered, often the current report will include the month prior.

parameters.name: reportType
parameters.description: Report type name, today the only report supported is "monitor".

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Indicates the period covered by the data with possible values of - day, week, month, quarter, annual

methods.description: Returns a list of all reports one is currently subscribed to.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to restrict the number of records returned if needed to be less than max.

apiDescription: This API will provide monthly data which includes metrics such as sales volume and growth rate.
